ns:common.topic.description: Flow Java is a conservative extension to the Java programming language. It integrates single assignment variables and logic variables, to Java. Its development was influenced by Mozart/Oz. Conceptually, the extension is similar to adding immutable futures but goes beyond that by incorporating equivalence groups.
rdfs:label: Flow Java

ns:common.document.text:
Flow Java is a conservative extension to the Java programming language. It integrates single assignment variables and logic variables, to Java. Its development was influenced by Mozart/Oz. Conceptually, the extension is similar to adding immutable futures but goes beyond that by incorporating equivalence groups.
Syntactically, the extension adds few new tokens  ...
...which introduces a single assignment variable, and...
...which binds s to a new object. Or...
...which binds s to o. This makes s equivalent to o.

ns:type.object.name: Flow Java
